com.cs262.sockets.client

Class ChatClient.MessageSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cs262.sockets.client.ChatClient.MessageSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    ChatClient

    private static class ChatClient.MessageSender
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Separate thread to handle the sending of messages. This is necessary because a message may arrive while the current thread is waiting for a user-input. Runs in a infinite while loop until the user chooses to quit the chat app.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageSender()
      Creates a new thread and run it

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the message sender thread by listening to user command line inputs, sending it to the chat server. In an infinite while loop, listen to user input commands. check that the command correspond with the login status. For example, sending a message requires the user to be logged in, while creating a new account requires the user to be logged out. For commands that require logged in privileges, append the current cookie to the end of the message Finally, send the message to the chat server. Quit the chat client app if the command ":quit" is keyed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • SendOverNetwork

        private void SendOverNetwork(java.lang.String message)
        Add header information, such as version number and length of message and send it to the server
        Parameters:
        message - message to be sent over to the server
